Reviews.Title: “Comfy and clean”
Reviews.Author: Fred B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business/holiday trip for a week. Decent rooms and freindly staff.Best part is full ktichen and brand new flat screen TV !The rates were fair (even though my company paid)but ask for weekly discount which is substantial. Lots of shopping & restaurants in the vicinity...easy access to west LA beaches and tourist areas. Will definitely recommend to my company for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: AHall21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location in Nothridge for 2 weeks and must say its a real gem! Its quite a no frills sorta place but has full kitchen which saves a LOT of money in Los Angeles!Decent ,clean&modern rooms with free parking and free internet etc only thing is there is no breakfast.Please provide at least coffee and donuts? The staff and manager is whats most valuable about this hotel.They ALL go out of their way to make you comfotable and provide good service which was really refreshing because in LA you usually get attitude but not here!I dont remember all the names but the manager is a young indian girl and she made sure we enjoyed out stay and even small problem like toilet not flushing was fixed immediately by a really nice man called Fredy. I would suggest try to get a room in the back for easy access and quiet . We would highly recommend this hotel for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend, and I am not a picky person”
Reviews.Author: 829Kat
Reviews.Content: I was staying there while in town for a job interview. After I arrived at the hotel I went to lie down for a few minutes. There were MANY hairs on the pillows (not mine). There was blood on the pillow cases (not mine). And there was blood on the pillows (yep, you guessed it: not mine). Got new pillows, no problem. Hoped things would improve from there. Went for a run before my interview and came back to find that the hotel does not provide ANY shampoo. So I had to run to Target about a mile away, after being told it was a block away-- to get shampoo. I had less than 30 mins to run to get shampoo and then get ready for my interview (which is an issue for someone with really long hair, like me.) After I got out of the shower I realized that there was also no hair dryer. So I called the front desk and said, "Do you have a hair dryer I could use?" And his response was, "We don't know where it is." ... So I went to my interview with really wet hair. It was embarrassing, to say the least. The next day, only one outlet and light worked --electricity went out in most of the room and they said there was nothing they could do. Then the hot water went out. I took a freezing cold shower and mentioned to the person whom I was interviewing with that she "should really ask for your money back"...She felt bad and so I ended up staying with her and her family...which is great b/c they are really nice people, but also probably awkward for them to have unexpected house-guests. I really not at all a picky person, I just feel that if you are going to pay a good deal for a hotel, there should be some sort of minimum standards. I've stayed in cheap Super 8's and they were much cleaner, with shampoo and a hairdryer in each room. I think Extended Stay America has some serious issues with this hotel's location. ps: also --there was smoke smell in my room and I am allergic to smoke.

Reviews.Title: “The Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: RobGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel clean and staff friendly. Behind the hotel is a Marie Calanders (restaurant) and the only issue I had had to do with the hotel parking. I guess there is a policy to have a parking pass on your car to remain in the parking lot. Was not informed of this on check-in but had a notice on my car in the morning warning that parking is for guests only and you risk getting towed. Only stayed one night so I didn't seek to get the pass from the hotel office.

Reviews.Title: “RUN, do not walk from this place!”
Reviews.Author: MagicalMuse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were going to attend a party in the area last Saturday night and decided to be responsible adults rather than driving home. You know how you pull up to a place and get a *bad* feeling? That was us here... There were two unsavory looking men loitering in front smoking, looking like they lived there and had nothing to do but loiter in front of the hotel, watching arrivals. We entered the lobby to check in, but there was (very obviously) a prostitute and her (very obvious) John checking in. In the lobby seated on the couch, was another seriously unsavory looking man with clearly nothing else to do but watch the world go by. Husband and I looked at each other and decided to leave. I made up some lame excuse to the guy about having to turn around and go home, and we weren't charged. Went to another hotel in the area. In a nutshell, this is a place that houses ex-con parolees and prostitutes. I've heard of places like this housing released prisoners. I can't imagine anyone wanting to stay in a place such as this, nor could I imagine children being here. Place may look spic-n-span on the outside, but definitely NOT a place we would feel safe at...

Reviews.Title: “Simple and efficient but not very good”
Reviews.Author: maehlum
Reviews.Content: I have several stays here in in connection with business trips over the last years since it was newly built in 2005. It is pretty average and not a particular good value for money. My main reason for staying here was the convenience of being close to my the business visited. There is no amenities apart from self-service laundry. On the positive side the Northridge Shopping mall is within walking distance and there are several restaurants close by. I would recommend this only for a short stay for business in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for business only...”
Reviews.Author: JustcallmeTab
Reviews.Content: The rooms are fairly clean but it is nothing fancy. It's defined ktroy not a place for romance. The service was just ok. This is the only hotel on my company sheet to choose from. Last time I made a reservation, I didn't write the confirmation # down like I should have. When I got there, the same lady that made my reservation was working &I told me that she had no reservation for me & no vacancy. I had to drive e a long ways to fi d another room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if looking to be close to CSUN”
Reviews.Author: gillsmail
Reviews.Content: My family and I had to find a hotel to stay at for my son's graduation from California State University Northridge. Being from Northern California we did not know the area very well and our option for hotels. I did a search on the internet and found Extended Stay America in Northridge. The price was very reasonable, and I needed to book two rooms, which they were able to accomodate when I called. I went ahead and booked this hotel, hoping the location was good and the room/hotel was clean. We were all very pleasantly surprised when we arrived! The hotel was very centrally located and close to CSUN, the staff were very friendly and curteous, and the hotel and room were very neat and clean! I definitely recommend this hotel...we will be back to stay when visiting our son!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, needs some cleaning”
Reviews.Author: PHXTrainer
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night for a quick trip, needed to be in the valley and the price was great. The room was decent size, small kitchen, pergo floors in kitchen and bath. Bed was decent. Only real complaint is the carpets in the rooms and hallways are kinda gross. You can tell where they have been cleaned due to the black dirt streaks. The bedspread was very gross, I just threw it on the floor and laid on the blanket underneath. For the price and location it is very much worth staying here, I just hope they clean up the common areas and get some new bedspreads. Also, There are many eating options nearby but I couldnt find a Starbucks to save my life... but that, I guess, is my cross to bear.

Reviews.Title: “easy access to NA”
Reviews.Author: gina_clean2day
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days and never got our "weekly" housekeeping service, going again in May will let y'all know as we staying 15 days this time, cost us 60 last time , this time 40 a night, cant wait to visit Korean restaurant across streeet as it was just opening when we were leaving fantastic food! The chain sit down place next door waited half hour to be served with only one other table with patrons in it, finally left. This trip will know to take our own food, pans, cleaning items for kitchen and ourselves as they don't stock anything. It's easy access to the World Service office of NA and tons of meetings. Best place for recovery yet in our travels across the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Roomy”
Reviews.Author: marina282828
Reviews.Content: We rented a room with double beds. It was spacious, nice, clean. They only clean the room once a week because it is for people that stay longer. That was ok. There is no food, no pool available. Decent area with lots of fast food and restaurants nearby. Paid $120 per night. Overall, it was a great stay. The front desk is extremely helpful and will mapquest anything for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, nice to stay in the valley”
Reviews.Author: cream111
Reviews.Content: I stayed Extended Stay for 2 weeks last year. The room was clean, we had no problem with it. Since it's located in the valley, it's hard to find a nice restaurants nearby the hotel. But the customer service was not bad, room was clean, once a week made service, so if you stay there more than week, it would be nice and cheap. When I stayed at there, one time, the fire truck came to the hotel, the bell was ringing for somehow, but it was just a mistake (the front desk said so) You can drive to Santa Monica, Beverly hills, to explore LA, so if you want to stay in a calm place, this hotel would be nice for you.

HotelInfo.Name: Extended Stay America LA/Northridge
HotelInfo.Address: 19325 Londelius St, Los Angeles, CA 91324
